Pore/Structural Features.Structure Type: Cubic porous network, built with six-connected Zr6 clusters and metalloporphyrins

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Volume exclusion due to the formation of large DNA-functionalized MOF complexes that block the glass nanopipette pore

Other Information.Test Conditions: Various concentrations (10 fM to 10^6 fM), constant voltage of +2.0 V, 10 mM Tris solution (pH = 7.4, 500 mM NaCl, 1 mM MgCl2)
Other Information.Additional Info: Forms DNA complexes (CP-target-SP-PCN-224) at the orifice and inside of the glass nanopipette, leading to a significant reduction in ionic flow. Ionic current blockage reached 92% for high concentration target DNA.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Reduced complex formation/binding due to single-base mismatch, leading to less volume exclusion compared to perfectly matched DNA

Other Information.Additional Info: Results in 76 ± 2.0% signal reduction, indicating less effective blockage and enabling discrimination from perfectly matched DNA (89 ± 1.6%).

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Reduced complex formation/binding due to mismatch, leading to less volume exclusion compared to perfectly matched DNA

Other Information.Additional Info: Discriminated based on mismatch; leads to less effective blockage compared to perfectly matched or 1-mismatch DNA.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Reduced complex formation/binding due to mismatch, leading to less volume exclusion compared to perfectly matched DNA

Other Information.Additional Info: Discriminated based on mismatch; leads to less effective blockage compared to perfectly matched, 1-mismatch, or 3-mismatch DNA.

Guest Molecules.Mechanism: Minimal specific complex formation/binding due to full mismatch, resulting in negligible volume exclusion

Other Information.Additional Info: Current change is around 10%, primarily due to nonspecific interferences, indicating negligible specific blockage by the composite probe.

Sieving Mechanism: Volume exclusion via formation of large DNA-functionalized MOF nanoparticle complexes that physically block a larger external pore (glass nanopipette), enabling size-dependent signal changes and molecular discrimination based on hybridization efficiency.

Experimental Validation.Method: Electrochemical sensing (ionic current measurements, I-V curves, EIS), Scanning Electron Microscopy (SEM), Fluorescence imaging, UV-vis absorption spectra, Z-potential measurements, N2 sorption isotherms, X-ray diffraction (XRD)
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Detection limit for target DNA: 10 fM. Ionic current blockage for target DNA: 92%. Signal reduction for perfectly matched target DNA: 89 ± 1.6%. Signal reduction for 1-mismatch target DNA: 76 ± 2.0%. Signal reduction for full-mismatch target DNA: ~10%. Impedance for 10^6 fM target DNA: 429 MΩ (6 times higher than without target DNA). Event rates 1.7-fold higher and signal-to-noise ratio improved from 9.0 to 15 compared to simple probe.

Other Information.Additional Info: PCN-224 nanoparticles (average size: 72 ± 2.5 nm) are used as a DNA probe carrier within a glass nanopipette (GN, ~260 nm diameter) for sensitive DNA sensing. The composite probe structure was optimized with a n(SP):n(poly T) ratio of 1:3. PCN-224 exhibits extraordinary stability, strong biocompatibility, and good optical quality (fluorescence signal).
